modules.description: This module creates and manages OpenGL textures from image data, handling texture parameters like channels, color format, and dimensions. It provides functions to upload pixel data to the GPU and render textures to a window. Concrete use cases include displaying images in a graphical application and rendering texture-mapped visuals in real-time.

This module manages interactive image display windows with real-time input handling. It supports creating windows with associated RGB or RGBA images, updating displayed content, and binding callbacks for mouse and keyboard events. Use it to build visualizations, image editors, or interactive simulations with direct user input.

This module enables displaying images in interactive windows with GPU-accelerated texture rendering. It manages lists of windows and named images, supporting background updates for real-time visualizations such as animation or image processing. The `Texture` submodule handles GPU texture creation and rendering with support for various color formats and dimensions, while the `Window` submodule provides interactive display windows with event callbacks for user input. Examples include rendering dynamic image sequences, building image editors, or visualizing real-time data streams with responsive UI elements.
